choices: Buy a hot dog
Run away screaming
1.content:
You find yourself standing, inexplicably, in front of a hot dog stand. You feel as if
you have amnesia, no idea how you got here. You’re starting to think you might
be suffering from the early stages of Alzheimers, which kinda scares you.

“I wanna be a part of it, New York New York..." Old Blue Eyes drones on, the
music coming from a cracked plastic boombox perched on the hot dog cart.

"Hey buddy, ya gonna buy a hot dog here or what? Don't just stand there staring, you're
creepin' me out!" the vendor says.
1.title: Decision Time

choices: Buy a bag of popcorn to feed the pigeons
11.content:
You buy a hot dog from the man and sit down on a nearby bench to rest. You eat your
dog contentedly, watching people stopping to buy popcorn from a street vendor. Suddenly
you feel something tapping on your foot.

You look down and see a pair of common pigeons pecking at your shoes.
11.title: Tuppence a Bag

choices: You notice a note tied to the pigeon's leg
The pigeon starts squawking at you as if trying to speak
111.content:
You buy some popcorn and sit back down at the bench to feed the birds. As a boy
you used to dream of having pigeons of your own: "Hey Dad, maybe you can help
me build a pigeon coop up on the roof of our apartment building, like Marlon
Brando had in that old movie? I could catch some pigeons for free, it wouldn't cost
you anything, and I could pay for their feed from my paper route money?"

But your father had refused: "Worthless godforsaken creatures, nothing more than
rats with wings! Forget it! Why don't you go play ball with your friends, that's
what I did when I was you age."

You wanted to tell him then, but didn't dare admit it: "But Dad, I don't have any
friends. The only kids who ever say anything to me are the older boys at school
that take my lunch money. And I stink at baseball, I always get picked last when
they choose up teams at recess..."

While you've been daydreaming of your past, one of the pigeons has boldly
approached close enough to grab a piece of popcorn directly from the bag you are
holding in your hand. This startles you and you look down at it.
111.title: On the Waterfront

choices: Sing the song
1111.content:
You look down at the pigeon and see a note tied to it's leg. You hold out a handful
of popcorn, and while it is busy eating you remove the note and read it.

"Whosoever finds this note shall be granted three wishes, providing said person is
able to sing the first two verses of the Pretender's "Back on the Chain Gang".
1111.title: Your Wish is My Command

choices: People start pointing and staring at you.
There is a loud thunderclap and puff of smoke.
11111.content:
You think it is a totally absurd proposition that singing a song as requested by a
note attached to a pigeon could even remotely have a chance at increasing your
fortune, but hey, you still buy lottery tickets. And you are a big Chrissie Hynd fan
and you do know all the words, so you give it a try:

"I found a picture of you, o-o-oh,
You had hijacked my world at night,
To a place in the past we've been passed out of, o-o-oh,
Now we're back in the fight

We're back on the train,
Back on the chain gang...

Circumstance beyond our control, o-o-oh,
The phone, TV and the news of the world,
Got in the house like a pigeon from Hell, o-o-oh,
Threw sand in our eyes and descended like flies

And put us back on the train,
Back on the chain gang..."
11111.title: Pigeon From Hell

choices: Leave the park, totally embarassed.
111111.content:
The people in the park are starting to look at you, and some are making rude
comments. You didn't realize your singing was that bad.

"Look at the weirdo singing to the pigeons!" a teenage boy yells out to his friends.

"Hey buddy, can you sing "Free Bird"?" a biker walking through the park yells out
at you, and his girlfriend beside him laughs at the joke.
111111.title: You're no Caruso!

choices: home
go to the beach
1111111.title: where to go?

choices: He's kidding, he grants your wishes.
He's not kidding, he takes you to Hell.
111112.content:
KABOOM !!! Suddenly there is a loud explosion. When the smoke clears you see in front
of you a short man with reddish skin wearing a dark suit. You realize he looks just like
Michael J. Fox from the sitcom that used to be on TV before he got Parkinson's.

"So, are you the genie that's gonna grant me my three wishes?" you ask.

"No I'm Satan, and I'm taking you to Hell!" he replies, struggling to deepen his voice to
try to sound evil.

"Oh come on, you're kidding! You don't even look scary!" You complain.
111112.title: Spin City

1111121.content:
"Yeah, I'm kidding, but didn't I fool you there, just for a minute maybe?" the genie
asks.

"Nope, not for a minute." you reply. "So, can I have my three wishes?"

"Yeah, I guess so. Go ahead and name them." he replies.

"I want to be as rich as Bill Gates, have as many beautiful women as Hugh
Heffner, and live with them all in a huge expensive mansion overlooking the beach
on Maui, that should about cover it." you respond.

KABOOM! in a flash you find yourself in your dream mansion surrounded by
beautiful women who wait on you hand and foot, immediately bringing you drinks
and lavish meals.

These women really adore you, and will do anything you want (and I do mean
anything), and you graciously take them up on their offers. But you're not as
young as you used to be, so the high life soon takes it's toll on you. Within a month
you are dead of a heart attack. (But hey, at least you die with a smile on your
face!)
1111121.title: Be Careful What You Wish For...

choices: Look up as a plane circles overhead
Start making little ones out of big ones.
1111122.content:
He suddenly transforms into a hulking behemoth with horns, he now somewhat
resembles "Refrigerator Perry", the old NFL player. "IS THIS SCARY ENOUGH
FOR YA?" he growls out.

"OK, OK, I believe you!" you reply.

Before you have time to react he reaches out and slaps a shackle on your ankle and
drags you screaming into a cloud of sulphurous smoke. You find yourself on a
smoldering desolate plain where he attaches your shackle to a chain holding a
dozen or so other poor souls. They are all wailing in misery as they struggle to
break rocks with sledgehammers while being prodded with pitchforks by fat little
demons who all look like Tattoo on the old "Fantasy Island" TV show.

“Get to work!” Satan says.
1111122.title: Back on the Chain Gang

choices: try to break the curse
ignore it
1112.content: you understand that one of the pinguins is a cursed girl
1112.title: girls fate

choices: Run away.
Take her up on the offer
12.content:
"AAAHHH! AAAAAAHHHHHH! You run away from the hot dog stand
screaming insanely. You've hated hot dogs ever since you ate six of them at the
fourth of July picnic when you were only seven and threw up eight times that
night. Must have been because they were sitting out too long before they were
cooked, but no matter.

You come to your senses and realize that you've wandered into a questionable
neighborhood. There is graffiti spray painted on the walls of the buildings and you
see an abandoned car with a cracked windshied parked in an alley off to your right.

A brown skinned woman with blonde hair wearing a dirty miniskirt approaches
you from the alley. "Hey honey, you wanna party?" she says.
12.title: Lookin' for Love?

choices: Stop in for a beer.
121.content:
You run away, horrified! Your own mother, so wasted she didn't even recognize you! You
hadn't seen her since last Christmas when you bailed her out of jail and loaned her the
money to go into court ordered rehab.

"I'm really gonna kick it this time!" she had said, but you didn't really believe her, and
weren't too surprised when her parole officer called a week later looking for her.

"Please call if she gets in touch with you, we really want to help her." the tired sounding
woman on the phone had said. You knew she was sincere, but by now Mom was no doubt
back on the streets, hustling to feed her habit...

You slow down to a walk, exhausted, and notice a topless bar up ahead on the right.
121.title: Feeding the Habit

choices: A large mug of "Past"
A small glass of "Future"
1211.content:
"...There is no pain you are receding,
A distant ship smoke on the horizon.
You are only coming through in waves.
Your lips move but I can't hear what you're saying..."

You recognize the song playing on the stereo, an old Pink Floyd tune. The dancer on the
small stage to your right is moving slowly and sensuously, eyes half shut, becoming one
with the music in this smoky dungeon. There is an older hispanic man with a cigarette
dangling from his lip leaning against the rail in front of the stage. He is trying in vain to get
the girl's attention with a five dollar bill. "Ahh, the zen of stripping..." you chuckle to
yourself cynically.

The bartender calls out to you "Two drink minimum or five dollar cover, buddy."

"What have you got on tap?" you ask.

"We only serve two kinds of brew here, Past or Future. What'll it be?"
1211.title: Comfortably Numb

choices: You wake up twenty years younger.
You wake up twenty thousand years younger.
12111.content:
You always were nostalgic. Although the past wasn't necessarily all that kind to you, the present holds no special place for you either. And with your cynical outlook, you have no desire to look into your future. "I'll take Past, make it a double," you say.

The bartender bring you a large mug, full to the brim. "That'll be three dollars."

"Here, and buy yourself one too, join me," you reply, pushing a ten across the bar.

"Thanks anyway, but I swore off the stuff," the bartender replies, as he pours himself a glass of tap water.

"That stuff will kill you," you joke.

You take a sip of your drink. It tastes so good that you chug it all down greedily, without stopping. A familiar flavor, but one you can't quite place. It brings back memories, like the smell of rain on pavement on a hot summer's day, or the warm scent of a woman from your distant past...

"Have a nice trip, see you when ya get back," the bartender says.

The room starts to sway and swirl, the light fading from your eyes. You grab the edge of the bar tightly, unconsciously reluctant to give up your grip on the Present...
12111.title: Forward, Into the Past

choices: Mourn Your 90's Wardrobe
Head Over To Starbucks... Cuz Everyone Else Is
121111.content:
Suddenly, you awaken in an alley. A group of twenty-somethings dressed entirely in flannel and jeans hanging off their asses have their arms around each other as each sobs mournfully. Interested, you approach them, "Hey guys, what's going on?"

One dude barely looks at you, but wails, "Kurt Cobain is dead!"

"Oh," you think, "yeah I remember that. So?"

"What will happen now?"

"To whom?"

"The world, man! How will the world continue when everything is falling apart?"

Rockers have been killing themselves -- whether purposely or accidentally -- since the dawn of rock n' roll. You didn't have the heart to tell him the world would continue pretty much without a hiccup in the absence of another dead rocker. He hoped they weren't fans of Alice In Chains, because lead singer Layne Staley would join Cobain eight years later.

You walk away, shaking your head, "I thought that bartender offered me a big mug of Pabst, not 'Past!' Damn!"
121111.title: You wake up twenty years younger.

info.brief_description: Hey buddy, ya gonna buy a hot dog here or what?
info.description: Another emotional fantasy/tragedy/comedy kinda tale in the Awakenings series, similar in feel to Stairway to Hell, but with a little less of the dark edge to it. Please rate, and add a chapter or two if you can. Thanks.
